derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from the noun piece + -meal from Old English mǣlum, in the sense 'measure, quantity taken at one time'

entry.tran: （变化或过程）逐渐发生的，零敲碎打的，零散的
entry.def: If you describe a change or process as piecemeal, you disapprove of it because it happens gradually, usually at irregular intervals, and is probably not satisfactory.

example.ex: Instead of the government's piecemeal approach, what is needed is a radical shake-up of 16-19 education.
example.tran: 需要的不是政府零敲碎打的措施，而是要对16至19岁年龄段的教育进行彻底变革。

means.word_mean: 1. a little bit at a time;
